title: Particle motion from quadratic velocity part - b

content.description: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at any time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = 3t2 − 2t − 1 . The position x(t) is 5 for t = 2 .
content.question: For what values of t,0 ≤ t ≤ 3 , is the particle's instantaneous velocity the same as its average velocity on the closed interval [0,3] ?

frqParts.text: For what values of t,0 ≤ t ≤ 3 , is the particle's instantaneous velocity the same as its average velocity on the closed interval [0,3] ?

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
